maqras.text: And those who look not for a meeting with Us say, "Why are angels not sent down to us, or we do not see our Lord?" Assuredly they have an arrogant conceit of themselves and excessive is their insolence
On the day when they behold the angels, there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and the angels will say, "There is a forbidden barrier for you
And We will turn on to the works which they have done, and make them like dust scattered
The companions of the Garden on that day shall be in a better abiding-place and a better noonday rest
The day the heavens shall be cleft asunder with the clouds, and the angels shall be sent down, descending in ranks
The true kingdom (sovereignty, dominion) on that day shall belong to the Beneficent, and it shall be a hard day for the disbelievers
And the day when the wrongdoers shall bite his hands and say, "O, would that I had chosen the way with the Messenger
O, woe is me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend
He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan is ever a deserter of men
And the Messenger says, "My Lord! Verily, my own people have made this Quran of no account
Thus have We made for every prophet an opponent from among the guilty; but your Lord is sufficient as good guide and helper

Those who disbelieve said, "Why is not the Quran sent down to him all at once (in one piece)?" It is revealed as it is so that We may strengthen your heart therewith, and We have rehearsed it to you gradually, in well-arranged stages
And they bring you no similitude but We reveal the truth and the best interpretation thereof (or a better argument)
They who shall be gathered upon their faces into hell, such are worse in plight and further from the path
And We did give to Moses the Book, and placed with him his brother, Aaron, as a minister (or Priest)
And We said, "Go you together to the people who have denied Our revelations. Then We destroyed them with utter destruction
And the people of Noah, when they denied the messenger, We drowned them, and made them a sign for mankind. We prepared for the wrongdoers a grievous woe
And (the tribes of) A´ad and Thamud and the people of Ar´Rass, and many generations between them
For each of them We set forth parables and examples, and each one have We utterly ruined
Indeed, they have come past the cities which were rained on with an evil rain; have they not seen them? Nay, but they fear not the Resurrection (or hope not for resurrection)
And when they see you (Muhammad) they only took you for a jest, "Is this he whom Allah has sent as a Messenger
He well-nigh leads us astray from our gods, had we not been constant to them." But they shall know, when they see the torment, who errs most from the path
Have you considered him who takes for his god his own lusts (prejudices, fantasies, superstitions)? Would you then be guardian over him
Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are but like the cattle, nay, they are further astray in the path
Have you not seen how your Lord spreads the shadow? Had He willed He could have made it still - We make the sun its guide
Then We contract it towards Us with a gradual contraction in easy stages
And He it is who made the night a covering for you; and sleep for repose, and made the day a resurrection
And He it is who sent the winds as glad tidings heralding His mercy; and We send down purifying water from the sky
That We may quicken therewith the dead land, and slake the thirst of the things We have created - beasts and men in great numbers
And verily, We have repeated it (the lesson) in various ways among them that they may remember; but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude
But, had We pleased, We could have raised a Warner in every village (or population centre)
So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith (with the Quran) with great endeavour
